intro: Phaca coquimbensis, commonly known as the Coquimbo phaca, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in arid environments and is often found in coastal areas. Phaca coquimbensis is adapted to withstand harsh, saline conditions typical of its native habitat.
